english.segment1: Mildred Madalyn Johnson. Born in the autumn of 1916
english.segment2: A shy, pretty girl from East Texas. Religious and restless. Humble and kind as a person could be
english.segment3: She loved to sing in the choir. Loud and inspired. Her head tilted down, keeping time
english.segment4: Or tell stories with friends after supper. Ignoring the hour. A calico cat fast asleep at her side
english.segment5: And she loved to drive. Her big red car. Though she couldn't see over. The hood very far. She'd back out the driveway. And point that thing down the road. We'd say, Lord, there she goes
english.segment6: Her hair was silver and messy. She walked in a hurry. Worried about wasting the day
english.segment7: Some nights she sat at her dresser. Composing long letters. Falling asleep with a pen in her hand
english.segment8: And she loved to drive. Her big red car. A scarf round her shoulders. Her foot to the floor. Down to the grocery. She'd wave good-bye. And we'd pray. Lord, bring her back safe.
english.segment9: And she loved to drive. Her big red car. Though she couldn't see over. The hood very far. She'd back out the driveway. And point that thing down the road. We'd say, Lord, there she goes
english.segment10: Mildred Madalyn Johnson. Marvelous woman. I was so lucky. To call her my friend
